Z_-BI2RTqx-dsGswJSz2Ow.text: I just ate here today and I had to write a review right away. I've lived near king fish but never came in and wow have I been missing out! I ordered the catfish poor boy with a side of crawfish chowder. the chowder was hands down the star of the show, I wish I could've ordered more but I was full. it was thick and flavorful, every bite had me wanting more. the sandwich was great too, they put big pieces of fish in there with veggies and sauce. it came with a side of fries and two hush puppies. even their fresh strawberry lemonade was yummy and not too sweet! the seating was simple and the employees were kind as well. i liked the CHOWDER so much I'm gonna come back tomorrow to grab a bowl for dinner!!

6C8FivFrhs6Br0m9Qi-ruA.text: Absolutely a great place for seafood lovers.  A bit of everything.  Includes dishes like seafood gumbo, jambalaya, ceviche, shrimp cocktail, combination plates on fried and grilled seafood, salads, beer and soft drinks.  Reminds me of those coastal restaurants where you also get steam crab and shrimp.  I tried the crawfish chowder and it is on point!  There are hot sauces to spice up your food like franks hot sauce, Louisiana hot sauce, crystal hot sauce, anddd tapatio hot sauce!  Freshly battered, and crispy corn crusted seafood.  Beer on tap!  Check menu for prices, they have great prices.  Tv for sports fans.  Great service.  Hope they can make tacos on soft shell corn tortillas, and of course flour too, since there is only crunchy shell 3 taco order, fried or grilled.

3MCx_wYyPwp3Cz3RjGj0zQ.text: Very good food and friendly service. I had the grilled shrimp kabob which comes with grilled veg and beans and rice. All was very well flavored and cooked well. The veg were not over cooked, so just like I like them :) The manager came around and asked us how things were and took our plates for us. It's a nice little place with no frills but clean and comfortable. I would definitely go back when I'm in the area again. If you do a check in you'll get free hush puppies.

0BBxuq0FU4kjK13YYMucQw.text: I was really excited to try out this Cajun restaurant, and it did not disappoint. Whenever a restaurant has jambalaya on the menu, I have to get it. However, most places that have jambalaya in Vegas are mediocre or worse. The exception is Oyster Bar, but I don't have the patience to wait in line because of the limited bar seating.  This is the best jambalaya in Vegas, period. It's loaded with chicken, shrimp, and sausage. The roux is flavorful and delivers a well balanced kick. The garlic bread is buttery and toasted perfectly. The service is fast and friendly, plus because this is a fast casual restaurant, the prices can't be beat either.  Well done Fish King Grill. Well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya
Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of 2/28/18

1xOQ6uylDXD3RqViUZlGnw.text: Today was our first time eating here and my husband and I absolutely loved it! We had Mahi (chose blackened option) salad and Red Snapper (garlic herb seasoned) dinner.  Both meals were to die for! Salad was crisp, fish was fresh and cooked to perfection, rice and beans were delicious!  They have so many seafood items as well as different options for drinks (including beers and wine)  Very reasonably priced and again, amazingly tasty!  Highly recommend, even for picky seafood customers like my hubby. ;)

bUBSq3FCCh6wY_2TqP0iKQ.text: The food here is amazing! Very friendly service too. I always get either the beer batter cod or the salmon plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened salmon plate

LgGl47sEh-_BPgWoDvQAXg.text: OMG!  All I can say is the food here is amazing!! Came here for the first time to celebrate my moms 59th birthday.  We ordered, and the food was ready quick and hot!  My catfish and shrimp spicy platter was everything!  Not to mention the clam chowder was off the chain. This place is a bit of distance from where I live, but I will definitely be back!    I wanna try more dishes!

Sqp8HfYmIpTqAFlEpQPdSg.text: Wow. This place was fabulous food! Definitely not a lot of ambience but I would eat here 5 nights a week if I lived in Las Vegas. I had the oyster po boy it was awesome big, juicy and lots of oysters plus 2 yummy pieces of catfish, a ton of fries and great hush puppies. I'm originally from Louisiana so I know po boys, catfish and hush puppies and I can honestly say this is the best one I've ever had in 60+ years! The lady next to me was eating huge friend Shrimp and she said they were "deeeeelish" they certainly were huge and another guy was eating blackened fish which he said was great. I will definitely come back next time I'm out here!

mM1yOMRJsa_Q5i5-KsYsBA.text: Sooo glad we stopped here. Everything was very good. The hush puppies are amazing! Good portions. Definitely worth trying!

j3l1FzF6mE_4bQ9NjEEdlA.text: Fish King Grill has some of the best seafood I have had in a long time! Don't pass it by based on appearance. The flavors are intensely good and you won't be disappointed. The must-try is the Crawfish Chowder. The service is excellent, the music is spot-on and I'm going back in October, first stop!

oRNgZZLmcLFPWExIijx8gQ.text: Our whole family really enjoys this place. Crispy not greasy. Authentic. Flavorful. Fresh. Excellent selection and real key lime pie (hint, it's yellow not green). Unique to fare in this part of the country.

YgMc2Fb52fvRmp3AOD7jrQ.text: I had been wanting to try this place for a while now and I'm happy I did! I had the catfish and shrimp combo wuth green beans and fries, and my boyfriend had the rainbow trout grilled with a salad. Their food was delicious! We will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy catfish and shrimp w/ fries and green beans DELICIOUS!!!!

iiseRx_XF_er1kfYwqeK6Q.text: If you are from the South and miss Louisiana and Texas cooking, this is the place. I miss fried Cat Fish so much and a lady at the market told of the place and I am so glad. I am on my way there, right now. This is my second time going. Peggy

Qa2Jy-ZhE-HxlMSMmd5eHA.text: Yaaasss!!! the food is good. I had the fried catfish poor boy and the crawfish soup.. So much flavor loved it!!!   I will definitely be returning. The staff was attentive and very nice. The restaurant itself is very nice and clean.. :)

VAJObFvUYeJh41JGBSPiQg.text: I had the catfish filet and shrimp, it seems they fry both together.. ugh . The hush puppies were so greasy and last but not least the fries looked disgusting I wouldn't taste them it looked like they picked them from the bottom of deep fryer after they had been there for a month . Now Im just going to keep it all the way honest I check these reviews so I when I go to these places I'm like people.. tell the truth cause that's twenty dollars I just wasted! So as a girl that likes good food don't waste you're money here.. I'm just telling you my experience.

qsCr37oYx0g0zY6ld27emg.text: Found this casual, Louisiana style hole in the wall restaurant that recently opened near me. Was in the mood for some good creole/cajun food and got it here. Very casual and clean. Fast food style as you walk up to the counter and place your order. Lots of great southern food choices. Service was fast, friendly and the food was delicious. I had clam chowder, hush puppies and jambalaya. All were excellent. I don't normally like hush puppies but these were amaze-balls! The prices are very reasonable. I highly recommend.

PU7vA9FZgJtTUaWYxzNPmg.text: Coming from out of town I went to this place Looking to get a good piece of fish. I ordered fish shrimp and oysters for 20.00 it was very dry and it was hard. Then I ask the owner is this acceptable. He look at me like hey it is what it is wow! He never try to make it right the food has no good taste to it at all people who eat here don't have a clue on what is good sea food is. Please stay away from this place now I have to use the bathroom as it wants out of me now my body is rejecting it as well. Not worth the time or the money

hftBPh8fMRxKpR517fSz9g.text: My family and I had a wonderful dining experience here! We all enjoyed what we ordered. It was delicious and reasonably priced. The decor was fun, clean,  and airy. The service was friendly and quick.  We will be coming back here again and be frequent customers from now on!

jbVoC74G8KE2DmQFimbKRg.text: Looking for fish on Lent Fri while waiting for a flight home in a few hours out of LAS. Friendly staff, great portions and delicious blackened flavors.

RVbqKvaotGSSk1_hisMa0w.text: Very good, and very straight forward!! This place doesn't try to get fancy and instead they do the basics really good!! -By9bdy-HetjiNXL1HXxaw.text: Yummy!  First time I came here I wasn't really feeling the gumbo over grits. That was when they first opened. Tried the place again and again and again. STFOernBxrEd7BvkyOZlGg.text: We love this place. This place is casual where you order at the cash register. We order out. The place is run by the family owners. They are very friendly.  We ordered the fried oyster basket,  whole fish with zucchini  and beans and rice, fries, corn on the cob, onion rings, and oyster po'boy. The icing on the cake was the yummy bread pudding  Everything was perfect  with a reasonable price. They accept credit cards too. There are no downsides to this place. We ordered four different times each was rapid and tasted wonderful.

BgzsBu0eIQnS55qQENADDQ.text: I have been several times and I am always pleased with the service and delicous food.  My favorites include: grilled orange roughy (choice of plain, blackened or lemon garlic-YUMMM!), grilled veggies, beer battered onion rings and HUSH PUPPIES!

-vynsilOi6DvfvQsFZBvZA.text: I wanted an uncomplicated but tasty meal after a crazy weekend in Las Vegas, and Fish King Grill delivered. Not only was my grilled rainbow trout both fresh and flavorful, but my sides went above and beyond. Who expects the veggies and rice to hit the spot at a fish shop? I also leaned over and checked out my neighboring table's fried fish and it made me jealous. Finally, just before leaving I hit the rest room and saw they had an orchid there. In the men's room! Who does that?! Fish King Grill. That's who.

Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DAR8XnrxiUVV6HIu1QyLtg.text: I am  a truck driver in town. Fish King Grill in on my Wednesday route. I tried them back in November and have been going there pretty much every Wednesday and order the 4 shrimp I catfish fillet red beans and rice. On 3-28-18. I went there for my regular lunch and their card reader would not read BOTH of my bank cards. Me being a loyal customer they would not provide me a free meal with my eight plus visit. I have multiple eight visit stamp cards but didn't not have them with me on this date, but the owner and his daughter who see me every Wednesday would not provide a 14 hr a day hard working loyal customer 1 free meal when their cashier was not in service. Bad customer service for loyal customers disappointed

1LvV3FIxiWDFddvCKRVp1g.text: This place is so good. Reminds of home the Bay Area totally fresh fish. We had the catfish, Cod,  and calamari so good FRESH. also had fried okra and the gumbo I was worried about trying but is was really tasty. It's a stew like consistency with a dark roux, really good! Has the perfect amount of heat!! Definitely pleased!!  Definitely will go back!

IOSeRrTsRKFMisFEJX7Lmw.text: The place could use a little bit of personality. A good paint or new chairs perhaps? Good customer service though. The pasta we ordered was somewhat a bit spicy to my palate but everyone is different. I loved the hush puppies, fried fish, fried oysters, and boiled crab. The French fries need a little bit of seasoning but there's nothing a little seasoned salt can't do. I would come back to this little hole in the wall when we're in town.

The catfish sandwich was simply amazing and so were the hush puppies.   The service was great and warm. Will definitely be going back.

RQ4ojA0qCEjgI1NK-EQHgQ.text: What a great restaurant that I wish we had at home. After looking on yelp, we were impressed with the menu, with what was offered for the price. Called to pick it up and it was ready on time. Quality was excellent better than expectations. We plan on going back before heading home.

Laid back, quick, clean meal option. I had the orange roughy blackened with grilled veggies and sauteed spinach. Great portion and excellent quality. hZRqKr4OTLlzaHD5aMwaVw.text: I can't speak more highly of this place. The fish is delicious and it's run by the kindest and most genuine people I've come across. We usually get the grilled orange roughy or red snapper. The calamari is good too. Don't forget to check in for free hush puppies.

7GsBYFSo2hqlH5yaY7QF5w.text: This place is good...so good that it is on the top of my list for affordable seafood! I came here with a group of friends and received prompt service. This place is really more of a "fast food"  kinda dynamic where you order to a cashier and then find a place to sit down. But please note that the food quality here is NOT the same as a fast food. The food here is fresh, made to order and very flavorful.   I ordered the shrimp po boy and really liked the flavors. It came with french fires and hush puppies. The shrimp in this po boy was " butterfly"  style and it came with a total of 4 shrimps. This was actually a pretty good amount because they are fried. The shrimp was also very well seasoned. I also ordered the crawfish chowder which I liked. It had a lot of seafood and was very flavorful.   This is a place I would def come to again even though it is a bit of a drive for me. Thank you for the great food!

HxZOOsVSe_F33N90SAHypA.text: This place was really good...  I was going to give them four stars because they're not a five-star Restaurant. However when I thought about it in the category they fall into there definitely five star.   I had a tilapia poorboy with coleslaw and it was really good. The tilapia was grilled and very flavorful. The hush puppies were very good as well with a little bit of real corn in it. I think anybody who eats there would be very happy they did so.   The place was very clean and did not smell like fish. That's a real giveaway in a seafood restaurant. The food took no longer than it should have to be prepared and all of the staff was friendly.  This place is not far from a friend of mine's and the next time I play golf with him I'll definitely come here.  They need to open one on my side of town Summerlin.

bcZOk-sZgtkNa0ik5woAkw.text: I felt like eating fried seafood yesterday so after I got home, my hubby took me to FKG.  We ordered:  1. Fried oysters (12) basket - my favorite.  The oysters were quite plump and good.   2. Fried 2 catfish and 4 shrimp basket - sorry catfish and shrimp, but you got overshadowed by the fried oysters.  These baskets came with fries and hush puppies.  I enjoyed the hush puppies because it was light, airy and crispy.  Nicely done FKG.  I also ordered a drink and did my own Arnold Palmer.  The sweet tea was brewed and lemonade is freshly squeezed...yes, none of that fountain high fructose corn syrup stuff.  I also checked in via yelp and got 2 more hush puppies.  The meal cost $38.95 before tax and though it is pricey, the quality food and drink we received were well worth it.  The only thing i wish this place would do differently is to fry their seafood in another type of oil rather than peanut.  My toddler is allergic to peanuts so cannot share the delicious fried foods with her.

uGGan1tKSxdd6lCtvEFi3A.text: Delicious and fresh. I always try to find places off The Strip when I'm in town. I'll definitely be back. Friendly staff and very clean. It was busy when we got there and found a table easily. The fish and chips (and hush puppies) were delicious. Recommended.

Ei3kdfGTu-wzADUBwvCChA.text: Been craving a po'boy and also something that I've never had before so this place has intrigued me for a few months.  Came here with some friends and was surprised at how spacious it was and well decorated the walls were.  Very friendly atmosphere.  I ordered a crawfish po'boy which came with fries and two small hush puppies (you get two extra if you check in on Yelp).  I also ordered a drink and a side of coleslaw.  The sandwich was tasty, although it was a bit small, it was packed with crawfish.  The coleslaw was good as were the hush puppies.  The addition of Louisiana hot sauce on everything kicked up this meal real nicely.    Pros:  A variety of tasty seafood, served different ways, in a kind and bright atmosphere.  Cons:  Although it is cheaper for seafood, it is a still a bit pricey for your average lunch.  My meal came out to $17.  The drink should be included in the price of the meal and the coleslaw was too pricey for the amount you get.    Overall I did enjoy this place as did my two friends who joined me.  I will definitely be back to trying their other offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coleslaw, fries, hush puppies (+2 for Yelp check-in) and a crawfish po&#39;boy.

TWrouI5mtZihcSLVTKzLSA.text: This place is great. I had the 2 catfish fillet email with fries and hush puppies. The fish was deep fried perfectly, it was nice and moist and nice and hot. The hush puppies were fantastic with some good flavor. The tartar sauce was actually amazing along with the cocktail sauce. They play some nice oldey timey music there. Great Casual  place!

LHhtKP9bxLp5SX770ckwaA.text: Can't believe I'm just finding out about this place. I've been living in vegas a little over 2 years and have been searching for a fish fry place for quite some time. My wife who's a True yelper(lol) searched for southern food and this place came up. The fried fish, shrimp, and calamari was seasoned very well. If you get a combo plate it comes with fries and hush puppies. I think it's a bit over priced, but still deserves a 5 star in my opinion. If you are looking for a fried fish spot, this is the place to go.

0LDR2PNosPfuX4Y18HkMdg.text: So my mom had wanted to try this place for a while since the nail and hair salon she works at is right down the street from them, in the Diary Queens plaza. Hearing good reviews from her customers, she decided to take me and my dad out to try it one night. We got there around 7 or 8ish and it wasnt very crowded, but wasnt empty either. Being my first time there, I didn't know what to get. However, my mom had said one of her customers recommended the Salmon Salad. So we ordered that, and the Sea Bass plate with two sides, plus their Gumbo.   The Salmon Salad was actually pretty good. The salmon was cooked just right and seasoned very well. We chose to get honey mustard as our dressing of choice. Mixed well with the salmon. However, again it's a salad so it's just mixed leafy greens with a slab of salmon on top. One good thing I liked about them is that they have the dressing on the sides in a small cup and you are welcome to ask them for more if you want.   The Gumbo was interesting. The rice and how it was cooked was a bit mushy, but crunchy on the outside probably from being pan-fried. Maybe also, the gumbo sauce itself had made it mushy. Anyways, the flavors were good too. I didn't care for the mushy rice, but I wish there were more shrimp and sausages.   The Grilled Sea Bass was probably my favorite that night. I chose to get it cooked in garlic butter, I believe and it tasted delicious! Very soft, flaky, and smooth. Again, this place really knows how to flavor and season their seafood because this sea bass was very well seasoned! The two sides I chose were the fried okra and corn. I didnt like the fried okra. Unfortunately this was something they didnt really season well; however, the basket is pretty full so you get a lot. The corn came out as a whole long corn. Very plain and simple with nothing on top. I thought they would maybe drizzle the garlic butter they cooked the sea bass in on top, but no. Also, I wish they would've cut it in half, but the workers were happy to do it if you asked them.   Another thing I noticed was how they don't have utensils or plates out in the open for people to get, so if you needed more plates or a fork, had to ask them in the front. Overall, I enjoyed my experience here and actually went back a second time just for the Sea Bass plate. For about $16, I thought it was worth it and affordable. It definitely does fill you up, so I would recommend getting that and doing the garlic butter. I tried the Blacken version and it was too spicy for me. I didn't really like how overly spiced the sea bass was.

EVlg1douw3PYu8ovCbpnZA.text: I'm on the fence about this place. I was super excited to try it because the menu looked appealing, but I wasn't too impressed with the food.   We ordered an Oyster Po' Boy (they spell it Poor Boy), and a Louisiana Basket (soft shell crab, shrimp, and oysters). The Po' Boy was a little under seasoned, and was topped with sweet pickles. When I took the pickles off it tasted better. The basket was seasoned and cooked well. Neither one of the items were great, they were just ok.   I will say, the place had a decent amount of customers so maybe we didn't order the right stuff. While we were ordering, I saw a salmon salad that looked really good. We're willing to give it another try, so maybe I'll get the salad next time.

p84sVuz1igEFKwP2TbKvCA.text: Surprising little place.   Very plain and utilitarian but good seafood served up hot and fresh.   One member of our party ordered a Cajun burger that was dynamite!       The fish was fresh and hot.  The slaw was crisp, not over dressed and tasty.   The hush puppies were good but could have used a little jalapeno for some kick.     The people working there were pleasant and quick on the draw.   I will definitely return to this little gem on Windmill.

I6f95eqswAUHYlN-pJS6pg.text: In town for the USBC Open Championships and have been sequestered at South Pointe for two days. Finally able to leave the property and found Fish King nearby. I can't begin to describe what a good decision it was to come here. First off, the restaurant is clean and has a very warm feel. The staff is courteous and knows the menu well enough to provide recommendations. Now on to the food.  I had the four shrimp, one catfish basket, spicy. The catfish was fresh and tender. The cornmeal breading was flavorful but not overpowering. The shrimp were pounded flat but were not rubbery. Again, very fresh. We also ordered the grilled chicken and veggies. The chicken was grilled to perfection; moist and flavorful. The veggies were also fresh and and very tasty.   I only want to add one more detail: the hush puppies are life changing. You will perceive the universe and humanity differently. The end.

xXzyFz-6307deXta5M7KNQ.text: I was pleasantly surpised! I ordered the Cajun Alfredo Pasta. It was REALLY good, very flavorful. The fresh strawberry lemonade was also quite good.

gJqyvWz72NAPROyKgXB_tQ.text: I LOOOOVE Chef Miguel and his entire family what can I say! Eat there now!!! I mean like today,I mean like right now before the shrimp is gone,I mean right now like......RIGHT NOW  All jokes aside. They rarely disappoint. If,at all. XiY2oeSoetQFVhm0lQGQ6w.text: I've been driving by this place for awhile not knowing what it was all about.  Today I went on yelp and found out that it is more of a Cajun, Creole type place.  I checked out their menu and I knew I had to try it.  I was wonderful and the people were friendly.  I had the Mexican Shrimp Cocktail.  I've been eating low carb so that was a good choice for me.  It had the right amount of spice and was big enough for a meal.  My husband had the fried catfish and said it was as good as some of the best places we had in the South.  The restaurant was clean and even though they had a lot of fish items going on it didn't smell like it.  That usually a good sign that the fish is fresh.  I found me a new favourite place!

DbVKSFeAhIwwS87obpy6fQ.text: Good value but indeed very pedestrian fare. Grilled Mahi-mahi with little flavor (tasted like it could have been frozen), plain fries. Not worth the eight miles drive, there are better options west of Las Vegas Boulevard.

I did take out some of the greens and tomatoes as the sandwich was insanely thick. Their tartar sauce is excellent.   Staff was kind, generous, and informative. -gsPMO8HTxf_82jntCWSUw.text: This place is a seafood haven! Let's face it, we're in the desert here and to get good seafood, we would have to pay top dollar. My first visit here, we were celebrating a birthday and the celebrant was craving seafood. Because we were a large group, we had to find a place that wasn't too expensive. When we yelped seafood restaurants near the office, this gem popped up. When we first arrived here, it wasn't what we had expected. It was a very casual dining experience. A nautical theme is their interior decor.   On to the food. One word...delicious! Because we were a large group, I had the opportunity to taste a number of dishes in one visit. Either I was really hungry or the food was truly delicious. I'm going with delicious because everyone loved all their dishes. The Jambalaya was very flavorful and packed with delicious ingredients like shrimp, chicken, sausage and more! The bacon wrapped jalapenos, calamari and hush puppies were on point as well. Each cooked and seasoned perfectly. Trying to stay on the healthy side? No problem, they have grilled options. I tried the blackened salmon, boiled shrimp, and grilled zucchini's. Yum, yum and yum! On another trip, I did a take out order and ordered the beer battered onion rings, fish and chips (beer battered cod), and jumbo shrimp. They did not disappoint! Because we got home a while after picking up the food, I threw them on a tray and popped them into the oven and they were just as good as if you were to dine in.   I'm already planning on what to order on my next visit.

xO-EWE-AesE3W0lV-RgFhA.text: Most people think of Las Vegas as being where all the great places to eat in town are, and people would not be wrong! To limit oneself to Vegas, however, would mean to ignore many of the hidden gems out in Henderson, including this Cajun and Creole-based seafood restaurant on Windmill and Bermuda! Located in the same area as the now shuttered Bachi Burger, Fish King Grill is one of the most surprising places to find affordable seafood -- and doesn't skimp on the quality! Little wonder it makes my list of personal favorite restaurants in town.  As mentioned before, Fish King Grill focuses on seafood prepared Cajun and Creole-style, with many recognizable items like jambalaya, gumbo, po'boys and hush puppies on their menu. They also have healthier options such as grilled fish or grilled seafood for those watching their weight, and the more adventurous can get items like fried oysters -- and this is one of the few restaurants I've seen that offer them!  For my review, I focused on three items: the clam chowder, the green beans, and the jambalaya. You generally get all of your food at the same time, so you won't have to worry about waiting too long for your food, at least.  Of the soups, the crawfish chowder and the gumbo are the more popular, though I opted to go for the clam chowder since I hadn't tried it before. What a great decision -- it was thick, hearty, and full of clams and potatoes! This was definitely a far cry from other clam chowders I've tasted that were either too watery, skimped on ingredients, or both. The green beans were also tender, but still had a nice crunch to them -- both items are not what I usually order here, but they're both delicious in their own right.  The jambalaya was more in line with what I usually order -- and it comes with rice and garlic bread. It was both savory and spicy, and deeply satisfying to eat by itself, but with the garlic bread and using it to dip into the jambalaya -- that makes it so much better in my opinion.  Much of the restaurants catering to Cajun-style food are either on the Strip or in the general region of downtown and the west side, which makes Fish King Grill a welcome addition to that collection of restaurants, especially here in Henderson! They have more than just these dishes on the menu, and as I said before, there's something for just about everyone here! Of course, this is just my take on it -- so why not try it for yourself?

My husband always gets the catfish and raves about it (I am not a catfish fan so I wouldn't know). I have had the shrimp po'boy sandwich, the grilled shrimp plate, and I have sampled my daughters hamburger and chicken tenders. Everything I have tasted has been well prepared and flavorful. The kids meals are plentiful and come in a cute boat complete with an Oreo cookie. The portion sizes are great and the price is unbeatable.

x7RUAnVkZU33ETL8lghiDQ.text: Grits and gumbo was excellent; I like dark roux, and that's how they do it here.  Wonderful!  Jambalaya was delicious but could have been just a little warmer; however, the shrimp were perfect, peeled and plump, and the overall flavor was excellent.  Calamari were small, which is fine by me, tender and crispy, and plenty of them; very good.  Clam chowder is very good, but more of a Cajun/Creole style seasoning than New England style; lots of clams though.  Crawfish chowder is very similar.  Beans and rice side was a little bland for my taste but still good.  Extensive menu.  No "fishy" or old seafood from what I've had and could smell, and all cooked perfectly.   I haven't tried the grilled fish yet, but it looks great from what I saw at other tables.  I'm looking forward to trying it.  Key lime pie was nice and tangy!  Yay!  Atmosphere is close to a fast-food kind of place with plastic table trays that you pick up when your order is ready.  Nonetheless, it's clean and perfectly acceptable.  The hard surfaces reflect a lot of noise, so you can hear what everyone in the dining area is saying; don't come here for privacy.   The order-ready buzzers will scare the hell out of you when they go off, but at least you know your order is ready.  Looking forward to trying more from the menu.  I'll be back.

IA-37bC7NpZcMcaNT6BJmw.text: What a great new little mom & pop place for seafood! Having grown up in the south, sometimes you get a hankering for some old fashioned cornmeal fried catfish. Stopped by on a Friday night, and I was surprised to find it so busy for a brand new restaurant. A great sign! Clean and spacious, there's plenty of room to dine-in, but I witnessed quite a few people ordering to-go as well.   I ordered the 2-piece catfish fillet basket and a cup of crawfish chowder. Let's start with the latter: wow! So much flavor in this little cup of chowder. Rich and hearty, there was plenty of celery and potato. More crawfish would be nice, but there was so much flavor (from a fantastic roux) that I didn't really care. Anyone who eats with me usually knows that I love to re-season my food when it gets to the table, but I didn't have to do a single thing to this chowder. It was perfect for me.   The catfish basket delivered on all its promises. The fish was fresh, tender, and juicy. The cornmeal batter was light and flavorful but not overly salty, and surprisingly not oily! The basket came with a good amount of fries (which were cooked perfectly for me contrary to other people's reviews), a hushpuppy, and tatar and cocktail sauces. If there was one criticism I had to give, I would suggest including 2 cups of tartar for 2-piece baskets. More fish would require more sauce, and it would be inconvenient for customers to have to ask for more.   Each table includes a generous tray of condiments to suit everyone's tastes, from salt and pepper to an array of hot sauces: red and green Tabascos, Cholula, and Louisiana Hot Sauce. The nautical theme of the space is calming and cute, and there's plenty of parking. After ordering at the counter, you're given a pager to notify you when to pick up your food. Tap and bottled beer, wine, and frozen margaritas are offered for your adulting pleasure. For healthier eaters, there's a large selection of grilled items if you want to avoid the fryer.   I am excited to return to try the catfish po' boy, grits and gumbo, jambalaya, fried okra, and creole pasta alfredo.

UcbMp-E_rix6xvSoi04zNw.text: So fresh and so good. Reminds me of New Orleans! Highly recommend the Louisiana basket their batter to fry all the stuff is bomb. Also their key lime pie is beyond delicious.

yPwLi5J821oaDX9R2lkF-w.text: A new seafood place? I'm in! This is a nice little gem, inside the plaza across from Vons. It's spacious and airy inside, with lots of light and the requisite nautical accoutrements on the walls. Plenty of tables are available to accommodate large parties.   They informed me that their seafood comes three times a week, from Mississippi and Louisiana. As catfish, crawfish and hush puppies are prevalent on their large menu, this isn't much of a surprise..LOL.   They were kind enough to let me taste the crawfish chowder, which was very savory and full of seasoning, with pieces of crawfish tails, and chunks of celery and potato. Being more of a clam and fish chowder kind of chick, I'd have to be in the mood to get this one, but I will definitely get some when the yen strikes me.  I decided to order the single fried catfish fillet basket, that comes with fries and hush puppies for $8.99. They allowed me to exchange the fries for sauteed spinach (sauteed in garlic butter, mind you) for no extra cost, and still threw in two HP's.   The fillet was crusted in cornmeal and was a good size for the money. It was light and moist, and not greasy at all. There was tartar sauce, cocktail sauce and lemon in the basket, along with a host of other condiments available on the table.  The HP's were good, but as I'm from Boston and don't have much experience  with them in the first place, I can't really elaborate other than that I was willing to eat them..LOL.   They have everything from salads, sandwiches ("poor boy loaf"), fried and grilled baskets to apps, combo baskets and boiled platters. They're happy to explain things and make recommendations as well.   All in all, this seafood critic is satisfied and would return. My only reasons for not giving five stars are that they don't have a lunch special menu, and that almost no one gets five from me because I'm a super picky bitch who isn't easily impressed..LOL

xFwBPZk9qX6gC-GQbhg7hA.text: Love this spot for eats.  Good service, yummy seafood and more. It has this southern/cajun/Mexican feel to it with the simplicity of the tables, chairs and decor but great beer and seafood to complete the vibe. They even have A frequent buyers card, bonus.

3315L17RonObPsL3VLNI8g.text: Oh Fish King, all hail to thee.   Crawfish Chowder: fantastic flavor, loaded with crawfish, not overly potatoed, veggies were still crisp, consistency was spot on. Every time.   Louisiana Basket (spicy): shrimp were lightly breaded, succulent, and easy to bite through. Catfish was tender, clean, and buttery. Hush puppies were crumbly, but not too much, and had just the perfect amount of sweetness. Fries were so crispy and so wonderfully seasoned, they may be our favorite fries in the city. But the fried OYSTERS... oh Fish King... all hail to thee for your oysters. One cannot explain the joy in the tears that ran from my eyes as I bit into that juicy, briney, gem from the sea. Heavenly.   Coleslaw: lightly sweet, lightly dressed, crisp, refreshing, palate cleansing.   Strawberry lemonade with sweet tea (strawberry palmer): knock out!  Bread pudding (to go): wish I had more room to eat it in house, but it was fantastic after we got home. The anglaise sauce was thick and buttery. A+  Our first trip will not be our last. Shout out to the daughter working the counter that talked us into the spicy basket. Killer!!

QJFWWc1fc1MDxffSvQPnMw.text: Whenever, my family and I are near the coast, we always order seafood.  So, during our most recent trip to Vegas, we decided to check-in at the Fish King Grill. As for the drink, the strawberry lemonade could have been slightly sweeter (I realize that flavors may be adjusted to meet the needs of various  individuals).  My husband and daughter enjoyed the catfish.  They said that their fish was well seasoned, fresh and hot.   The food was prepped quickly and the customer service was great!  If you're in Vegas give this restaurant a try! We would definitely return to the Fish King Grill on a future visit.

eDODZ9x7JPDcs6NNeghsWw.text: Just moved to this side of town and we're so happy to have found this place!  Chowder is amazing and love the fried shrimp burger!  Very pleasant & casual atmosphere and very clean.  TVs for the games. Definitely a thumbs up!

941YA67ogjxId4r-tL2sKg.text: Excellent!!! Had the shrimp chowder. First time ever and it was delicious!!! Very clean place and the staff was super friendly.  Many fish items to chose form their menu.

Td4YFeERiT6tUE8YeWRbNQ.text: Pretty disappointed. Recently visited here after wanting to go for quite some time. I just wasn't impressed at all. Maybe it was what I ordered, the shrimp po boy. I've driven past and kept telling myself to try them out and when I finally did, it just wasn't very great. Wasn't bad, but I probably won't go back again. The strawberry lemonade was really good but other than that, the food was mediocre and even from looking at other guests food I just didn't feel impressed. Sad that it didn't live up to my expectations.

DDXA6h97ADDVSNeqWlOnDQ.text: The best place I found to get a fish dinner from so far. If you are from the Midwest then you know where I'm coming from. The catfish basket was Cajun style but it was still tasty. When I went in I didn't think those guys in the back was capable of a fried fish dinner, boy was I wrong...all those good reviews were legit. I will be back. Thanks.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gkpLk1ZQaqo0hrca3ND8tA.text: This is my second visit and once again the Fish King did not disappoint.  The garlic butter orange roughy, grilled veggies n hush puppies were simply delicious. Great service and perfectly cooked food will definitely keep me coming back!!!

tU8rFI5QvXTFJxEPGoRRhQ.text: This was so good! I would highly recommend you try!! Had the craw fish poor boy and it was delicious

MzE4jnaPNxa00WzHiyS5nw.text: The service is very friendly. I ordered the catfish and shrimp basket. Shrimp were huge  as tasted great. Catfish could of been crisper. Hush puppies were very good.

-UB_44Oh6bw5y-P5LZ9EVw.text: I had the jambalaya and a cup of gumbo while my wife had a fish and shrimp platter. Both dishes were awesome being from Louisiana I had to make sure they were worth the hype based on previous reviews. It was very good till the point I couldn't finish it all. My family will return for round two soon!

LaOXeEnHYAFAtftWGJc4bA.text: Food is delish and prices are great! Had the fish tacos, very tasty. Next time I'm trying the catfish basket with hush puppies!

eJWGvaZgmhfytnuhIl_PbA.text: The only 2 times I have been the fish has been excellent and they even listen to special request of how I wanted it prepared. The side are fresh and made with care. A must try!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled rainbow trout with blackened w/ garlic butter and grilled zucchini &amp; squash and side of sautéed spinach

pVFu65voB7wK_FFCL5DJDA.text: Ordered the 4 shrimp 1 catfish combo with okra instead of fries and husband had the bbq shrimp po boy. Both meals were served hot. Had really good flavor and was surprisingly not salty at all, which is a bonus for us. Would definitely go back.

3RKSfnpfdKPyeMjhj_o7Mg.text: Food was so good I could only take this photo of my cleaned up Grilled Catfish Plate. Fish melted in my mouth while being tender and was seasoned perfectly. Beans and rice is always the perfect side dish. Their grilled squashes and zucchini is the only one I've ever tasted that's been done right and not mushy. Service is great, one of the servers noticed I was looking at the wall menu so she grabbed me a take home menu. Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NViVjsVkHUcdkytyamVfXA.text: I ordered Grilled Catfish with sauteed zucchini, beans and rice with scallions. The meal was delicious!! My fish was grilled to buttery, flaky perfection! Everything was spiced with such flair my taste buds danced a jig! They also set a Louisiana vibe with blues and musical classics playing in the background. I will return!

VhnakMnM6ng_VY6swd4T2Q.text: The grits and jumbo is awesome! I will be coming back soon to try the fish. The people that sat next to me got fried catfish and it looked divine. I highly recommend this place and i will be coming back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dbVWFi3ECyBXZ69EYxc55Q.text: Really great experience. We ordered the grilled red snapper and fried catfish which were both delicious. It's very obvious that the fish here is fresh. They use cornmeal for their fried fish and it's much better tasting and easier to stomach than the usual heavy batter. This place deserves 5 stars but the beer in the frozen mug makes me wish I could give it 6.

w5Qy5J3htVQIc40d2-zHoQ.text: I had the orange roughy prepared with garlic and butter, my girlfriend had shrimp kebabs, both meals were excellent. The price you pay for the food you get is an excellent value. I hope this place gets lots of business and stays around for a while.

rNp61g-1Ym-S4tE28goUEA.text: Amazing!! Fish (had tilapia and rainbow trout) was fresh and well seasoned. The vegetables, corn, and rice and beans were soooo good. Highly recommend this seafood spot!! Staff was really friendly and the place wS clean. Have been to many seafood joints and this is at the top of the list!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish King Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tilapia and rainbow trout!

UbbvrkVQbm4G-lXtz4-Z2Q.text: Wow, we surprised to find this hidden gem in the shopping center near our house. We were there for dinner on a Saturday night. The hubby had grilled talapia with beans & rice and fried okra. He was well pleased, said everything was delicious. I asked for a wild caught fish and they suggested the orange roughy. It was cooked perfectly and was very fresh. My sides were seasoned good and were excellent Overall, this place is a very good value for the quality of food. Restaurant is spotless and has a nice decor. Would recommend giving it a try if you're in the mood for seafood.

WQRFHNJ1nh-SMZV3jBOF4Q.text: Great local restaurant with very fresh seafood one of the Staples of Las Vegas you got to have fresh food and this local restaurant has a great service and really fresh seafood it's not the cheapest place in town but it's also fresh food so you get what you pay for. I'm really glad that it's on my side of town - I normally get the salmon salad which comes with a ton of lettuce and a big piece of salmon but they have a lot of different options they have a gumbo soup as well that was terrific everybody seems to really enjoy it and it's a good vibe.

JsMN1dJBwxNkWt-ZTrzmUQ.text: Best hush puppies, full of flavor. Big pieces of fish. Cooked wonderfully with lots of options.  Friendly staff.  Clean and large dining area. Love the decor and the TVs. I'm totally about supporting local businesses- sick of big box places with crappy service.  This place is welcoming, charming and friendly. All the things that will make me come back.

EYsWY9QSRrsDuxRTv8nFgg.text: Wow!  Visited based on a recommendation.  This was a strip mall restaurant at a reasonable price but could rival any seafood restaurant on The Strip.  First the basics: The Big "A" from the health department, spotless restaurant (all tables were cleaned and the floors swept), spotless (Mens') restroom (with hot water too) and friendly service.  I heard several Sirs before we even sat down.  We had the salmon which was well prepared over rice (garlic and buttah!).  Fish and chips were very good with spectacular tarter sauce.  And the crab legs with potatoes and corn on the cob were delish!!!  We are now regulars.

ntBdHXLoG9d76pV-J5xJ7A.text: Great food, fast service and clean restrooms! What more could you want? You order from the counter at the front and they either call you back up via a pager or bring your food to you. My wife and I had the lunch special which was 1/2 po' boy sandwich and a cup of soup. She had the fried catfish sandwich and jambalaya and I had the fried shimp and seafood gumbo. I have to say, as good as the sandwich was, the gumbo was great. And they don't scrimp on the shrimp. Price was reasonable (some would even say inexpensive given the ingredients).

NuV-JpoEKe2Qd5WX6cPekg.text: if you want to eat healthy, this is the right place to be. portions are enough, side dishes are good as well as the meal. i like there lemonade. the service was little slow, they are busy every time we go there. they have a lot of choices for seafood. the seasoning is good too. what i did not like was that my veggies were raw, they were grilled but needs more cooking, it ended up to be bitter and could not eat it anymore.   will definitely come back

33Jiz_DLr0TVKpw2Ha4vcg.text: Just could not have been more pleased. We actually wanted to go to Bachi Burger but they had a staffing problem. Saw this and walked in. First ordered the hush puppies. They are OUTSTANDING. We travel a lot in the south and these are the best. The price is outstanding as well. Wife had catfish salad. Catfish was incredible. Biggest drawback was the tomatoes.  I had the crayfish chowder. Just so tasty and made my mouth happy. Service was right on as well.

15_Rwj2WHfOD-4mN-wk4KA.text: This was one of the BEST foodie experiences my husband and I have had in Las Vegas. Our family tried the seafood pasta, gumbo, catfish, okra, and the bread pudding. The pasta was amazing with fresh shrimp, andouille sausage, and shredded chicken.  I am a huge fan of bread pudding and Fish King offers by far the best in town! The service was nice and it's a family friendly dining experience. A great place for lunch or dinner. We will be back soon!

SOJUnX3fwBGsYF-5zcQFjA.text: We are so happy to have this restaurant in the neighborhood. Their menu is bomb and we can't wait to try it all. We split the tilapia and catfish poboy which were both so delicious. My husband couldnt stop raving about it.he aslo said the owner was extremly nice when he picked up our order. We hope for much success for King Fish Grille.

rLQYpOLaeC1zzBZldW8fiA.text: i ate the jambalaya for lunch and barfed my brains out 5 hours later. i still feel pretty sick now even 8 hours later. i'm not sure if fish king grill was the culprit but i only had a granola bar earlier in the day so i don't know what else it could be. i really hope it wasn't the culprit because i had high hopes for this place and still do. the food is expensive for this type of restaurant and the portion sizes are a little on the small side. but it's a very nice looking restaurant and the jambalaya tasted really good so i'm giving 2 stars. it would be great if they would lower the prices 1 or 2 bucks or make the portions 20% larger. i hope management can examine their food prep and cleanliness to make sure everything is safe.

ao2b_y22A1TTWaKD3XT5Yg.text: Tonight was our first time. I have to say it's the best fried catfish is the best in Vegas. They also know how to do a poor-boy right! Definitely be back soon!

nk-42_ocb_FpokBDUtPVAQ.text: First time here, definitely will not be our last. Order the jambalaya and the blackened rainbow trout, both were excellent and seasoned well. Finished off with a slice of key lime pie.

lFt38MDvT8Ef4-0EbyxkWA.text: Interior is great.  Food portion are generous for the price and service was great.  It is a nice seafood option with grilled and fried seafood.  My friend got grilled salmon which looked delicious.  I had fried shrimp and catfish which was great.  Both of us left stuffed.

5Y0XsKoboyRvl40iESxzXw.text: I've eaten at this place twice an love it. It's very reasonably priced and the fish is very fresh and delicious. If you eat healthy you can definitely order that way here.

1ReYjohby-DhsCgTDIFDQg.text: The Catfish is real good and the bread pudding is to die for.  The place is actually a pleasant surprise that has a lot of thing on the menu I really want to try.  Give them a try and you will not be disappointed
